content: the embers shawl is a stunning and unique accessory sure to become a favorite featuring hand-dyed yarn and simple construction for a gorgeous addition to your wardrobe this beginner-friendly asymmetrical crochet shawl works up quickly using simple stitches and an easy-to-follow pattern a versatile design that can be worn in several ways lightweight yarn ensures this shawl does not become too heavy or bulky to wear around the neck this asymmetrical shawl is created by increasing the stitch count by one stitch on the same side for each turned row and repeating sections using half_double_crochet making this project a quick easy and satisfying make any #3/dk weight yarn can be used but this project would be a great way to use those special hand-dyed hanks from your yarn stash that you have been holding on to this pattern is written in standard us terms skill level - easy the featured scarf uses a us size h/8 5 mm crochet hook and #3/dk weight yarn approximately 750 yards used in the ablaze colorway by montana crochet featured yarn details weight #3/dk 100% superwash merino 250 yards additional yarn suggestions premier colorfusion dk wecrochet city tweed dk lion brand moroccan nights i used right at 3 hanks 750 total yards of hand-dyed yarn with no leftover yarn please make sure to purchase additional yarn if you wish to add length or embellishments like tassels or fringe to your finished shawl finished shawl approximately 34 wide and 57 long down the side that does not increase
